intro: Tetrapterys discolor var. brownsbergensis, commonly known as the Brownberg's false mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
